@twentyforty

I need a help...
Do you know how can I mux a h264 file and aac file into a MP4 container.

Basically I need something like mkvmerge...

Quality:    +1045 / -0 (+1045) 

Am I ?

Whats Happening..

thanks for this as well as Red Riding trilogy
awesome

@DownTYU:

Simple.  One line ( all my encodes are muxed that way):

nicMP4box -add audio.m4a -add video.264 -fps 23.976 muxed.mp4

FPS number is essential and could be 23.976, 25, 29.97 or 30 or any mp4box defaults to 25 fps.
@DownTYU: Muxer mux - you must say what and enter one or two numbers. No muxer, including mkvmerge shouldn't make decision what OUTPUT fps should be. Haven't you heard off Variable Frame Rate?

@spiritualiste:  ...and week later had hard disk crash and lost 1 TB of encodes.
Sorry, maybe someone has it, but it was just ad, sneak-peek and maybe someone would make a torrent and inform you here.

Learning session!!!!!!!!!!!!
Well I don't know much but I can remember once I've faced this with YAMB. YAMB prompted me to enter fps or I've selected the track and pressed properties - defined fps. Something happened; but it worked.

Sir, I also have a question. As I told you earlier that I remux all the supporting files into a single; I also add cover poster using itag of mp4box. It looks good as Windows shows the poster in thumbnail. That thing I've learned from 'puplone' (thanx to him) but he don't know much (nevermind: he is my friend) as he couldn't answer this:
How can the poster be extracted from the mp4 tag on later stage?

The commandline I use is:
"\mp4box.exe" -tmp ""  -add "\old.mp4" -itags cover="poster.jpg"  -new "\new.mp4"
You mist be knowing but just for reference ...
